data.title: Historic Pharmacies and Medicinal Gardens’ Route and the Italian Coordination: Two Days Focused on Heritage and Youth
data.text:
On March 11, 2024, in Rijeka, during the 2nd International HPMG Forum, the Abbot of Montevergine, H.E. Riccardo Luca Guariglia, signed an agreement with the International Association Aromas Itinerarium Salutis (AIS), to host the Third International Forum HPMG in Italy and to establish coordination in Italy closely connected with the actions and activities of European partners, also in view of the events of the Jubilee of Hope in 2025.

The presentation event of the European Route of Historic Pharmacies and Medicinal Gardens and the Italian Coordination, held on April 19, 2024, at the Abbey Palace of Loreto in Mercogliano (AV), was inaugurated by H.E. Riccardo Luca Guariglia, the Mayor of Mercogliano, lawyer Vittorio d’Alessio, the President of the Irpinia System Gerardo Capozza, the Chief of Staff of the Minister of Tourism Counselor Erika Guerri, and Senator Giulia Cosenza, Vice President of the Senate Culture Commission, Drafter and Signatory of the Bill S.939 “The Way of the West”, which recognizes Montevergine, within the Benedictine Italian itinerary, as a reference point for historical pharmacies and medicinal gardens.

This was followed by a technical focus held by Professor María Luisa Vázquez de Ágredos Pascual, director of AIS, regarding aspects related to the Cultural Routes program of the Council of Europe, and by architect Carla Maurano, designer and coordinator in Italy of the Itinerary, regarding the challenges of knowledge and integrated valorization of cultural heritage related to the coordinating role assumed by the Montevergine Abbey.

The technical focus gave voice to the reflections and key points of the coordination project defined during the meeting of Italian partners held on April 18, 2024, at the Library of the Montevergine Abbey, attended by: María Luisa Vázquez de Ágredos Pascual, director of AIS, Simona Tardi, Executive Secretary of AIS, Cristina Expósito de Vicente, Secretary of AIS, Carla Maurano, designer and coordinator in Italy, Giuseppe Pandolfo, member of the international Steering Committee of AIS, Alessandro Crisafulli (Botanical Garden “Pietro Castelli” of the University of Messina), Enrico Indelli (Salernitana Medical School Foundation), Mauro Bardaglio (www.ilgiornale.ch), Caterina Babino (Mediterranean Identity Association) and on behalf of the international Steering Committee Eva Usmiani Capobianco (JGL Pharmacy Museum) and Miguel Alvarez Soaje (Galicia Slow Tour).
